prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Manfred von Karma
Description: My mentor who has never known defeat in 35 years. A legendary prosecutor.
Character 1
Name: Byrne Faraday
Description: Prosecutor in Embassy staff killing case. Accused by Rell of being the Yatagarasu.
Character 2
Name: Deid Mann
Description: Cohdopian Embassy staff member. Was gunned down in front of Embassy by Rell.
Character 3
Name: Mack Rell
Description: Embassy staff killing suspect. Arrested on suspicion for the handgun he was carrying.
Character 4
Name: Yatagarasu
Description: Real identity is unknown, but claims to be a noble thief. Infiltrated the Embassy.
Character 5
Name: ??? → Kay Faraday
Description: A girl with a balloon. During the recess, she asked me to change some coins for her.
Character 6
Name: The Judge
Description: Judge in Embassy staff killing case.
Character 7
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: New rookie detective at the precinct. First crime scene. Seems very enthusiastic.
Character 8
Name: Calisto Yew
Description: Lawyer of embassy staff killing defendant, Rell. I was to battle her in court.
Character 9
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: Eagle-eyed homicide det. Was called in to be expert witness on the Yatagarasu case.
Character 10
Name: Manny Coachen
Description: Cohdopian Embassy staff member. He was the suspect in the KG-8 Incident.
Character 11
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor's daughter. Studying to be a prosecutor in Germany, back on break.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. My mentor said it was more chic to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: KG-8 Incident Overview
Description: Received from my mentor as reference about KG-8.
Evidence 2
Name: Det. Gumshoe's Testimony
Description: Was in hall on guard duty. Other than gunshot, didn't hear a sign of a struggle.
Evidence 3
Name: Handgun
Description: Was Faraday's evidence from Embassy staff killing case. It was found in his hand. Found in Faraday's hand. Bullet that killed Rell was fired from a few yards away.
Evidence 4
Name: Knife
Description: I believe Faraday brought this as evidence. It was found in Rell's hand. Weapon used to kill Faraday. Has the secret ability to change into key the Yatagarasu sent.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Scene Notes
Description: Notes pertaining to Byrne Faraday and Mack Rell.
Evidence 6
Name: Plastic Bag
Description: One of the bags strewn on floor of Lobby No. 2. Has Faraday's blood on it.
Evidence 7
Name: Mr. Faraday's Fountain Pen
Description: Fountain pen used by the left-handed Faraday. Looks like it has a quality nib.
Evidence 8
Name: Annual Bonus Envelope
Description: Det. Gumshoe's annual bonus of $5. Literally had no money on him until he cashed this.
Evidence 9
Name: Swiss Roll
Description: Swiss roll dropped by the mysterious young girl. Says "Courthouse Special" on it. Swiss roll dropped by the mysterious young girl. It's priced at 2 for $6. Detective Gumshoe and Kay bought this Swiss roll together.
Evidence 10
Name: Det. Badd's Testimony
Description: He heard the gunshot right before the trial was about to start again.
Evidence 11
Name: Det. Gumshoe's Fingerprints
Description: Left on the hallway bench. Black smudge emits the scent of sweet sugar. Left on the hallway bench. Det. Gumshoe apparently sat here as he ate a Swiss roll.
Evidence 12
Name: Balloon Piece
Description: I just know I've seen a pink balloon around... Found on windowsill of the hallway window. Balloon popped by Kay. The Judge misheard its popping for a gunshot.
Evidence 13
Name: Promise Notebook
Description: Exchange diary between Mr. Faraday and Kay.
Evidence 14
Name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
Description: Perfume given to Badd by Yew. Same perfume as the one spilled in Lobby No. 1.
Evidence 15
Name: Mr. Faraday's Organizer
Description: Faraday wrote his strategy for winning in here.
Evidence 16
Name: Yatagarasu's Key
Description: Photo of key the Yatagarasu sent. Unusual shape. Photo of the key the Yatagarasu sent. Turns into knife.
Evidence 17
Name: Surveillance Video
Description: Video of the Embassy staff member's murder. Gunshot is especially impactful.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: ...I was in Lobby No. 1... talking with Yew.
Person: Badd
Testimony 1
Testimony: ...We were talking about... some trivial things.
Person: Badd
Testimony 2
Testimony: ...I heard the gunshot... right before the trial was about to reconvene.
Person: Badd
Testimony 3
Testimony: ...I didn't hear any other strange sounds... until that gunshot...
Person: Badd
Testimony 4
Testimony: When we heard it, Yew and I immediately dashed out into the hallway together!
Person: Badd
Testimony 5
Testimony: I saw Gumshoe goofing around there... and then we all ran in to Lobby No. 2.
Person: Badd

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. The task is to find one pair where the evidence and testimony don't match up.

First, I'll go through the testimonies. Testimony 3 is from Badd, and he says he didn't hear any other strange sounds until the gunshot. So according to his testimony, the only sound he heard was the gunshot before the trial started again.

Now looking at the evidence. Evidence 2 is Detective Gumshoe's Testimony. It states that he was in the hall on guard duty and didn't hear any sign of a struggle other than the gunshot. Wait, but there's also Evidence 12, the Balloon Piece. The balloon popped by Kay was mistaken by the Judge for a gunshot. So maybe there were two sounds: the actual gunshot and the balloon popping. But Badd's Testimony 3 says he didn't hear any other sounds until the gunshot. However, the balloon pop happened during the recess, which might be before the trial reconvened. Testimony 2 from Badd says he heard the gunshot right before the trial was about to start again. The Balloon Piece (Evidence 12) mentions that the Judge misheard the popping for a gunshot. If the balloon popped during the recess, maybe that's a different time. But the contradiction here could be that there were two 'gunshot-like' sounds: the real one and the balloon. But Badd's Testimony 3 claims he didn't hear any other sounds except the gunshot. However, the balloon pop was during the recess, so maybe that's a separate event not related to the time Badd is talking about. Alternatively, the Swiss Roll (Evidence 9) is connected to Gumshoe and Kay buying it together, and the fingerprints (Evidence 11) show Gumshoe ate a Swiss roll on the bench. If he was eating during his guard duty, maybe there's a timing issue.

Wait, another angle. Evidence 3 is the Handgun, which states that the bullet that killed Rell was fired from a few yards away. But Testimony 3 says Badd didn't hear any other sounds. But the crime involved a gunshot, so maybe the testimony is about other sounds. Alternatively, perhaps the gunshot was heard, but the testimony says no other sounds. Wait, no—Testimony 3 says "didn't hear any other strange sounds... until that gunshot", so the gunshot is the only sound. But maybe there should have been a struggle. However, Evidence 2 (Gumshoe's Testimony) says he didn't hear a sign of a struggle other than the gunshot. So that matches. Hmm.

Wait, let's think again. Testimony 3 from Badd: he didn't hear any other strange sounds until the gunshot. But Evidence 12 says the balloon popped, which the Judge thought was a gunshot. If the balloon popped at a different time, but the testimony is about the time before the trial reconvened. The balloon pop was during the recess, so perhaps that's before the trial restarted. Then, the Judge's mishearing might be a separate incident. But Badd's testimony mentions hearing the gunshot right before the trial restarted (Testimony 2), and Testimony 3 says no other sounds until that. But if the balloon popped earlier (during recess), that might not affect this. Alternatively, maybe there were two gunshots: the real one and the balloon pop, but the balloon was popped during recess, so the Judge's confusion is unrelated. Therefore, maybe the contradiction is elsewhere.

Looking at Evidence 12: Balloon Piece is on the windowsill, popped by Kay. The Judge misheard it for a gunshot. So if the Judge heard the balloon pop as a gunshot, but Badd's testimony says he heard the gunshot right before trial reconvened. But Badd is testifying about the actual gunshot (the real crime), whereas the balloon pop was during recess. So maybe those are two separate events and not conflicting. So maybe another pair.

Wait, Testimony 0 and 1 from Badd say he was in Lobby No. 1 talking with Yew about trivial things. Then, he heard the gunshot (Testimony 2), and then in Testimony 4, he and Yew ran into the hallway. But maybe the key contradiction is between Badd's Testimony 3 (no other sounds) and the Balloon Piece's popping, but only if the balloon pop happened at the same time as the gunshot. However, the balloon pop was during the recess, which might be before the trial reconvened. So the Judge's mishearing might be a different time. Therefore, perhaps the contradiction is between Badd's Testimony 3 and another evidence.

So perhaps the contradiction is between Evidence 12 (Balloon Piece) and Testimony 3. Because if the balloon popped (and the Judge thought it was a gunshot), but Badd says he didn't hear any other sounds except the gunshot. Wait, but when did the balloon pop happen? According to Evidence 12, Kay popped it during the recess. The Judge misheard it as a gunshot. cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user wants one pair. Let me start by looking through the testimonies and the evidences.

First, the testimonies by Yew. Testimony 3 says she doesn't know where the knife that killed Faraday came from. Testimony 4 mentions a key in the evidence bag and that you can't kill with a key. Now, looking at the evidences. Evidence 16 is the Yatagarasu's Key, which is a photo of a key that turns into a knife. Oh, wait, the key can change into the knife. So if the key transforms into the knife used to kill Faraday, then Yew's claim about not knowing the knife's origin is contradicted by Evidence 16. Because the key (from the evidence bag) is actually the knife. So when Yew says she doesn't know where the knife came from, but the evidence shows the key transforms into the knife, that's a contradiction. Therefore, Testimony 3 (index 3) is contradicted by Evidence 16 (index 16). Let me check the numbers again. Testimony 3 is the third one (index 3), and Evidence 16 is Yatagarasu's Key. Yep, that's the pair.
